title: Do intelligent people tend to become rich? - Quora

response.answer_text: Intelligence is a heavy responsibility! Ok…ok…I am not intelligent…but I am rather smart, thus understand intelligence… It all starts when they are very young… Pre school…kindergarten…and elementary, they see their peers/friends as dumb or boring. They tend to be loners and ‘look inwards’ to find entertainment or challenge. At this age, if either parent is intelligent, then can become good mentor and provide challenging environment while growing. Money is not necessarily a big motivator…unless they grew up ‘dirt poor’, suffered and ‘wanted to show the world’ by becoming a Billionaire… Once they realize the gift of intelligence, they start to feel the weight… At first they are happy (or even euphoric) thinking they can do anything… Then they start to realize it takes more than intelligence… At this juncture, they splinter into different paths. The ambitious/ optimistic ones continue to pursue ‘Changing the World’ agenda The timid/ pessimist tries to hide behind the crowd and pretend ‘I’m just smart’ The competitive/ selfish goes for money or other status to show their ‘greatness’. For the rest of us, if you come across the first type, either help them or move out of the way, you will be doing humanity a favor… If you come across the second type, hire or partner with them and they will be the main ‘engine’ of success…(just make sure to compensate fairly…) If you hire the third type, you end up being ‘stepping stone’ and they become dominant player in the industry…

Not necessarily, there are many people with enormous ability who languish in very ordinary jobs, and I have met some homeless people who were articulate and extremely clever, but they had fallen on hard times, or a death/tragedy had caused them to lose interest in succeeding. I have encountered some exceedingly dull, rather stupid people who were very wealthy indeed, they had focused on making money and happened to choose the right market to work in. You cannot draw a valid corollary between intelligence, and wealth, although I guess it is fair to say capable people usually do alright in the world, but life can be a very variable feast, and conditions emerge which are unpredictable, there are no guarantees.

There is a positive correlation between wealth and intelligence and between income and intelligence. The study of intelligence is done by statistics. There are usually multiple variables operating at the same time and some of them interact, leaving a complex constellation of factors. In this case, the following each correlate with wealth: incomeageeducationoccupationpersonality traits conscientiousness and opennesssavings habitsemotional stability You can read about the interactions between these factors in A. Frunham, H. Cheng (2019) Factors influencing adult savings and investment: Findings from a nationally representative sample, Personality and individual Differences 151. For a more condensed and easy to understand discussion (by a top cognitive scientist), read this: The intelligent investor Then, on the same Unz site, look for and read these three pieces: The Wages of Intellect (Part 2) Family Fortunes Family Misfortunes In the end, you will learn that intelligence is one cause of wealth. As with all statistical findings, this one is not deterministic at the individual level. Smarter people simply are more likely to be come wealthy than duller people.

response.answer_text: There is far less correlation between intelligence and wealth than one would think. Of course, a genus invents a great new “something” and become wealthy as a result. but very many, not so intelligent people get their hands on lots of cash. All you have to do to become wealthy is to control your expenditure to well below your income - and save the rest. Sooner or later, you become wealthy. Nothing intelligent about that at all.

response.answer_text: That depends. There are a LOT of intelligent people who never become wealthy, as well as many that do, but on the flip side; there are many unintelligent people that become wealthy as well. It all comes down to financial intelligence. You have to read and understand information about HOW to become rich, if you want to be rich (unless you inherit your money). The trick is to learn about passive residual income and how to invest in assets and minimize your liabilities.

I am a 66-year-old retired Silicon Valley engineer who worked for over 30 years with some of the smartest people on the planet. Did they want to be rich? Usually not. Being intelligent, more often than not, gives you a completely different value system than those who don’t share your world view. That’s hard to understand I know. But it is the truth.

Can they, of course. Do they tend to, probably not. There are a lot of intelligent people who don't have plans on being rich and probably more than a few who don't care about wealth. Knowledge acquisition and expanding one's intellect can be its own reward. And living pragmatically and realistically doesn't require great wealth.

response.answer_text: Rodrigo, No. Just because you have a higher I Q doesn't mean you may be great at business. You may prefer to be a scholar. Intelligence is the measure if what you know, not whether you apply it. You can employ advisors who will guide you to wealth success if that is what you want. You only have to look at Kylie Jenner and her cosmetics success. We all know Kylie does not have a PhD, but she has business advisors that have fully accentuated and guided her in business and what she likes, so she can become a success in this domain in doing what she likes- cosmetics.

response.answer_text: To some extent yes, but there are plenty of people with Masters and PhD's in the gutter and a few not-so-bright people who have reached success, such as the current resident of the White House. So it's not a sure thing a smart person will be rich, and not a foregone conclusion a dumb person won't be rich.

Only if they are also possessed with motivation and find an opportunity. Lots of people are intelligent, the majority of them will never be rich. More here: Vincent Beers' answer to If you are intelligent, why aren’t you rich?

No, that is a myth perpetuated by the rich. Intelligent people are only slightly more likely to become rich than anyone else. IQ does not overcome the ‘quality’ of quantity, and everyone wants to be rich.

response.answer_text: This is an ancient question answered a gazillion times. I was at a MENSA Convention. I asked what kind of work people in MENSA do. A member said: “There are two kinds of people in MENSA; the unemployed & the unemployable. They can be dishwashers or anything.” I know a young man working on a doctorate on Ancient Languages at NYU. He also seems unemployable. His sister's are terrified of him.
You don’t need to be academically smart to be rich. You hire those people.
